original: Öhman, Arvid 0’skar Fredrik, fil. lic., Gö|teborg, f. 2/7/05 i Kristianstad av styckj. Janne Ö. o. Johanna Swensson. G. 37 m. Gertrud Bengtson. Barn: Rolf f. 38, Gunilla 41. — Stud:ex. i Kristianst. 23, fil. kand. i Lund 26, fil. mag. 27, fil. lic. 32, provår 34-36. Vik. adj. i Kristianst. 27, 28 o. 31, e. lär. i Ängelholm 33-34, v. Gbgs h. real 35-36, vik. adj. v. Gbgs h, latin, numera Hvit-feldtska h. a. 1., 36-37, e. o. 38. Ordf. i Gbgskrets. av Sv. extralär: för en. 38-41, ordf. i ett flert. studentfören. Stud:-vist. i Göttingen 28, Frankr. 31, UD stip. v. NF i Genève 31. Skr.: Ur Gustaf Adolfs skrifter (32), upps. i Statsveten’sk. tidskr. o. Sv. uppsl :bok samt div. bidr. t. tidn. o. tidskr.
translated:
Öhman, Arvid Oskar Fredrik, M.A., Gothenburg, born 2/7/05 in Kristianstad, son of butcher Janne Ö. and Johanna Swensson. Married 1937 to Gertrud Bengtson. Children: Rolf born in 1938, Gunilla in 1941. 

Education: High school diploma in Kristianstad in 1923, Bachelor of Arts in Lund in 1926, Master of Arts in 1927, M.A. degree in 1932, teaching internship from 1934 to 1936. Temporary substitute teacher in Kristianstad in 1927, 1928, and 1931, permanent teacher in Ängelholm from 1933 to 1934, substitute teacher at Gothenburg High School for Boys from 1935 to 1936, temporary substitute teacher at Gothenburg High School for Girls, currently at Hvitfeldtska High School, from 1936 to 1937, associate professor since 1938. Chairman of the Gothenburg district of Swedish substitute teachers from 1938 to 1941, chairman of several student associations. Studied in Göttingen in 1928, France in 1931, and received a scholarship from the United Nations in Geneva in 1931. 

Publications: Contributions to "Ur Gustaf Adolfs skrifter" (32), essays in the Journal of Political Science and Swedish Encyclopedia, as well as various contributions to newspapers and magazines.

structured.name: Arvid Oskar Fredrik Öhman

affiliation.name: Gothenburg district of Swedish substitute teachers

structured.description: Arvid Oskar Fredrik Öhman, M.A., born on July 2, 1905 in Kristianstad, Sweden, was an associate professor and chairman of the Gothenburg district of Swedish substitute teachers. He was married to Gertrud Bengtson and they had two children, Rolf (born in 1938) and Gunilla (born in 1941). Öhman studied at Kristianstad High School and Lund University. He worked as a teacher in various schools and was associated with Hvitfeldtska High School. Öhman also had publications in different journals and contributed to the field of Political Science and Swedish Encyclopedia.
